questions.question: Charles Babbage's mechanical computer design.
questions.explanation: The Analytical Engine was Babbage's design for a programmable mechanical computer.

questions.question: First computer programmer, who wrote algorithms for the Analytical Engine.
questions.explanation: Ada Lovelace wrote the first algorithm intended for machine processing.

questions.question: The first stored-program computer.
questions.explanation: EDVAC was the first computer to store programs in electronic memory.

questions.question: Computer architecture model with stored programs.
questions.explanation: Von Neumann architecture stores both data and programs in memory.

questions.question: First commercial computer available to the public.
questions.explanation: UNIVAC I was the first commercial computer produced in the United States.

questions.question: Company that created the first microprocessor.
questions.explanation: Intel created the 4004, the first commercial microprocessor, in 1971.

questions.question: Apple's first mass-produced personal computer.
questions.explanation: The Apple II was highly successful and established Apple in the PC market.

questions.question: Operating system developed by Linus Torvalds.
questions.explanation: Linux is an open-source operating system kernel created in 1991.

questions.question: Programming language created by Dennis Ritchie.
questions.explanation: C was developed at Bell Labs in the early 1970s.

questions.question: Company that developed the first graphical web browser.
questions.explanation: Netscape Navigator popularized web browsing in the mid-1990s.
